result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trovon Damont Cornell

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Status Report

1:39 PM Defendant Trovon Damont Cornell not in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared with legal intern McKenna Mathie by video for Trovon Damont Cornell.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sanders advises Court that the Defendant in custody in Dane County.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 03:16 PM  Defendant Trovon Damont Cornell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Trovon Damont Cornell.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $1000.00 signature bond set with conditions.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 3 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022
